module.field:
The Feature Model (Variability) describes Product Line characteristics (Features) that may differ among members of the Product Line. The differences between members may be captured from multiple viewpoints such as functionality, quality attributes, environments in which the members are used, users, constraints, and internal mechanisms that realize the functionality and quality attributes (ISO 26550:2013). 

Steps to construct the Feature Model:

  1. Create Work Items of type Feature.
  2. Construct a tree of parent-child relationships between Feature items.
    Indent a Feature item to make it a child (i.e. sub-Feature) of the previous Feature item.
  3. Select a Variation Type for each Feature (see Feature Properties, below).

After creating a new Feature item, you can specify these properties:

  • Feature Title
    Represents the feature in reports, charts, specifications, etc. When you create a new Feature item, you can enter the title immediately.
  • Feature Description
    Fully describes the product feature. Start on the line following the title and write normally using any available formatting features. Optionally insert images, tables, diagrams, etc.
  • Variation Type
    Describes a Feature's inclusion in different product specifications. A Feature can have one of four Variation types:
    • Mandatory feature - Feature must be included in every product of the Product Line, or if a sub-feature, must be 
      included if its parent feature is included.
    • Alternative feature - Feature is one in a group, of which exactly one (and not more) must be included if the parent is included.
    • Optional feature - Independent Feature that can be, but does not have to be included.
    • Or feature - Feature is one of a group, at least one of which must be included if the parent is included.
  • Additional relations
    Links between Features that denote additional relationships depending on the link role:
      > Requires - one Feature requires another one to be selected
      > Conflicts with - one feature requires another one NOT to be selected

TIP: To edit the Variation Type field of a Feature item, you need to show it in the Work Item Properties sidebar:

  1. Select a Feature item in the Features section below, and open the Work Item Properties sidebar (if hidden).
  2. Click the Gear icon in the header and select "Show Fields".
  3. In the box on the right, select "Variation Type", choose the option "Show in Sidebar and Document", and click the Apply button.

Create your Feature type Work Items here.

TIPS: Click the Feature icon in the toolbar above to create a new Feature item. Click the icon of an existing Feature for a menu of options. You can delete the sample items below, or modify them to be actual features of your Feature Model.
